bibl.title: G.M. Savage v. William Billings. Writ
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

div1.p: On reading and , the petition of G.M. Savage duly sworn and verified by him whereby it appears that he is illegally restrained of his liberty by William Billings Sheriff of Thurston County at the term of Olympia Thurston County Washington Territory, and stating wherein the illegally commit from which it appears to me that a writ of habeas corpus ought to issue. It is ordered that a writ of habeas corpus issue out of and under the seal of the District Court of the Second Judicial District of Washington Territory holding terms at Olympia direction to the said William Billings Sheriff of Thurston County aforesaid. Commanding him to have the body of the said G.M. Savage before me at Chambers in said Olympia on the 29th day of March 1884 at 1 1/2 o'clock P.M. to do and receive what shall then and there be considered concerning the said G.M. Savage together with the time and cause of his detention and that he have then and there the said writ
Dated on the 29th day of March 1884.
In the District Court of the 2nd Jud Dist of Wash. Ter. holding terms at Olympia
Petition of G.M. Savage for Writ of habeas corpus
Received and Filed March 29 1884 R.S. O'Rion
